text: What editor is HubSpot using? When I worked for a web forms provider in the past, we were using ckeditor to markup html that will later be fed to an HTML > PDF converter. So we had to tame the wysiwyg and were able to do it. I'm sure HubSpot can do it too.
There is 7days trial. Look for it.

so we occasionally get asked to generate HTML packages of our HubSpot emails for our clients so they can send it through another platform. What do people generally do when given a task like this? Do they just preview the email and copy the source code or do people export it to HTML somehow from HubSpot?

if my email is a coded template I give them the full coded file but add comments where all of the HubL is and tell them what it does so it can be changed for the specific email service they’re going to.

If drag n drop I’d consider converting to coded in the design manager and doing the same

I should add, if you’re using a framework like foundation for emails. I would also package all of those files and send them over too, that would allow them to update the email through the framework, if they have a dev that knows how to use that.
anyone else get one of these for each of your HubSpot CMS sites?
yes all our website
Interesting.
Yep, got that warning too
Most people wil.
Looks like time spent in Search console today!!
Just had 5 support tickets come in just now from each of our clients saying we broke something :joy:
Do you have an example of an AMP blog post that is generating this error?
DM'd
It appears AMP now requires a featured image with a width of at least 1200px
In the cases I have looked at, the image widths have been <1200px
Not sure if there is a way to auto-fix this other than choosing a new image with width >1200px
is it just me or is it bizarre AMP would require images  1200px? lol thought they wanted speed.
<@U6GNQ7JBU> maybe a solution would be to warn when setting a featured image to a smaller size, about AMP, if AMP is enabled for the blog/page.
Yea we can add the warning
They are trying push AMP for desktop

ahhh,…. that’s…. going to be interesting…

I get that it makes sense for like third world countries where internet speed is terribad, but if you’re in a situation where speed isn’t an issue, you shouldn’t get linked to the amp version of the site :disappointed:
AMDP - Accelerated Mobile Desktop Pages
We likely need some kind of new setting as they also want 3 images with different aspect ratios
Feature suggestion that might solve this: add to the HS CDN a parameter that can crop an image
methinks the chrome extension’s Amp button is about to get a lot of use
I dont understand AMP all that much. If your site is responsive and optimized for performance, whats the advantage...
even faster load times on mobile by stripping out unnecessary fonts, JS, etc. More helpful for those who might not have their site optimized as well
is my understanding at least
makes sense

the advantage is a slightly better load time AJ.

basically most of the assets like the JS can be pulled from the same URL basically providing CDN capability for the JS but everyone is using the same CDN so it’s theoretically even better because odds are the resource is already cached.
It makes sense for other countries outside the US, and for mobile. But I wish when your site’s actuall speed is the same or faster than the AMP version it would auto load your actual site
<https://www.geek.com/tech/beyonces-production-company-sued-over-website-accessibility-1768309/>
Stay safe out there
has anybody messed with lazy loading images on HubSpot?
i was looking at this <https://github.com/ApoorvSaxena/lozad.js>
and this <https://github.com/craigbuckler/progressive-image.js>
Fun Fact, there is actually a group of legally blind people out there who all they do is look for sites with accessibility issues and then sues them
learned that when we had a company come to us because they were being sued and we ended up fixing all their accessibility issues.
i believe <@U38EZFVFE> and <@U7V9DQ31P> have played with lazy-loading images
blazy.js
It must be difficult looking for the sites when you’re legally blind
it does images, background images, iframes, videos, etc
and can do responsive images
`resize_image_url` HubL function is your friend if you go for the blur up technique
That really seems to straddle the line between being progressive and being predatory
yep. i agree with <@U7V9DQ31P>

Yup, agreed. Was crazy when we ewre doing it as the company that came to us was a government institution so they were required to comply due to that, but something as simple as a website for a bar or cupcake shop could also be sued.
This sounds more like social networks to me.
you also get the advantage of being in a feature card when the list the articles in the search
this is one of my biggest fears...
Yeah that’s a bit much. Definitely gives us a little more job security though!
And liability!
what tools do you all use to help fix this? I've used the WAVE plugin but wondering if there is something better
I’ve also gone the css only lazy loading method via resize_image_url (blur up using just css)

So for the company we worked with, we used Wave for things like color contrast checking on some stuff but the main one we used <https://siteimprove.com/> their tool basically audits the site and give you a list of all the issues with it
If you read the article.. they were sued over not having alt text
then you can fix and rerun on a url
yea, i feel like that ones kind of a cheat on google’s part though, to get people to use it. there’s no reason they can’t do that with normal posts
I've also used this as well: <https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/axe/lhdoppojpmngadmnindnejefpokejbdd>
Rock on, thanks AJ. Definitely will checkout siteimprove
Just make all images background images, then you don’t need alt tags.
but if they have direction text, you might lol, best way, go to chase banks website and see how they implement their accessibility
like a logo

BTW.. in this case I have close friends that are family to Beyonce and Jay, They get frivolous lawsuits filed against them on a monthly basis. Just because they are super wealthy. They are really good people.
Markup wise, that logo makes me angry.
lol
You dont sue a city cause their sidewalks dont have guide strings.
I can't even imagine the ridiculous lawsuits most celebs have to go through
It’s better to be undercover rich

I forgot who said it (i think it was a comedian or might even been a reddit post) but if you g to a party and everyone is in suits, look for the guy in jeans and a t-shirt and you've the richest person there
So true. I’ve met a few billionaires in my life and they’ve all been wearing like sweatpants
So should I wear sweatpants to dress for the job I want?
thats what i do lol
Don’t lie, you’re a billionaire and working on HupSpot sites is like your Hameau de la Reine isn’t it?
I'm so wealthy, i didnt even know it.
#capitalism its theirs. they set the rules
yall.js is pretty cool and lightweight too. (yet another lazy loader)
